docs.snippet: FERNANDEZ--Sara Pena, died peacefully at home on February 10, 2010. She is survived by her cherished husband Dr. Oscar E. Fernandez, her daughter Helen Fernandez and husband Gerard Murphy, her daughter Carmen Romero and her husband Tobin Romero, h...
docs.lead_paragraph: FERNANDEZ--Sara Pena, died peacefully at home on February 10, 2010. She is survived by her cherished husband Dr. Oscar E. Fernandez, her daughter Helen Fernandez and husband Gerard Murphy, her daughter Carmen Romero and her husband Tobin Romero, her son Oscar G. Fernandez and his wife Stacey Usiak along with four grandchildren and a large and loving family in her native Colombia, where she was a lawyer and judge prior to emigrating to the United States in 1965. Visiting at Fox Funeral Home, Inc., 98-07 Ascan Ave. (corner Metropolitan Ave.), Forest Hills, NY, Saturday and Sunday from 2-5pm and 7-9pm. Funeral Mass at Our Lady Queen of Martyrs R.C. Church (Ascan Ave. corner Queens Blvd.) on Monday February 15 at 10:30am. Cremation service private.

docs.snippet: The full screenplay for the Oscar-nominated film "In the Loop" is online, in all its unexpurgated glory....
docs.lead_paragraph: If you've ever wanted to see a bunch of profanities, obscenities and other choice words strung together in wildly inventive (and literary, of course) ways, you'll be happy to know that IFC Films has just posted the Oscar-nominated screenplay for Britain's "In the Loop." It's a challenge to print any excerpts on the blog, but you can head here to read the whole raucous thing. As A.O. Scott wrote in his review last July, "If Anglo-Saxon epithets were armaments, Britannia would rule the waves."
docs.abstract: The full screenplay for the Oscar-nominated film "In the Loop" is online, in all its unexpurgated glory.

headline.main: 'In the Loop,' in Its Own Choice Words
